11e6cc3f-b78e-4c60-bef8-af006d831c5f.description: To support those interested in starting the journey towards open conversations about diversity, equity and inclusion, this self-paced, asynchronous course offers lessons in perspective taking, bias, privilege, and more - leading the way towards understanding and engaging in difficult conversations.
11e6cc3f-b78e-4c60-bef8-af006d831c5f.name: Difficult Conversations for DEI

badge_template_activities.title: Virtual asynchronous self-paced course. Learning Objectives: 1) To learn how to create optimal conditions in your own mind to facilitate learning and help you to become more aware and sensitive to DEI issues 2) To learn key skills for having uncomfortable conversations 3) To blueprint crucial conversational structures

e0ad0d4b-2f7f-4bda-968e-90796f0eec50.description: Inclusive Skills are key to creating a inclusive workplace. Whether leaders or individual contributors, the application of inclusive skillsets by employees creates a sense of psychological safety and ultimately engagement and belonging. This multi-workshop program includes pre-, inter-, and post-session asynchronous learning, two to three synchronous workshops, as well as accountability partner meetings to encourage peer learning and engagement.
e0ad0d4b-2f7f-4bda-968e-90796f0eec50.name: Inclusive Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Workshops - Unconscious Bias, The Reframe: a deep dive into the behavioral psychology of unconscious bias, defining the many different types of biases and how they result in poor decision-making. We teach learners how to slow down their socialized thinking and reframe the narrative. Difficult Conversations. Managing conflict and having candid conversation is often layered with fear and awkwardness. This training outlines specific communication skills to honor all perspectives in a conflict situa

Workshop 2 - Difficult Conversations. Managing conflict and having candid conversation is often layered with fear and awkwardness. This training outlines specific communication skills to honor all perspectives in a conflict situation. By anticipating reactions in the moment and preparing for the resistance, team members are prepared to successfully manage the inevitable conflict that occurs in the workplace.
Learners practice applying their inclusion skills after each workshop session, and meet with their accountability partner for peer learning and to share their experiences applying their new skills.

a106f2b0-19d5-4b38-9c0c-9496a72cd26d.description: Orange Grove's Women in Leadership program helps transform organizations into more diverse and engaging workplaces. Participants emerge from this program with a clearer vision of career success, a personalized go-forward plan and a new set of advanced leadership skills to help them increase their impact on the organization. This multi-workshop program includes pre-, inter-, and post-workshop asynchronous work and accountability partner meetings.
a106f2b0-19d5-4b38-9c0c-9496a72cd26d.name: Women In Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: This program consists of synchronous workshops presented on-site or through virtual meetings. The multi-session program uniquely addresses the underlying assumptions of what it means to be a high potential woman. The program is comprised of a minimum of four workshop sessions, such as: Reframing Gender Bias; Reframing Confidence; Assertive Communication and Executive Presence; Self Promotion/Promoting Your Value; Strategic Thinking.

Learners practice applying their inclusive leadership skills after each workshop session, and meet with their accountability partner for peer learning and to share their experiences applying their new skills.

02254293-ca34-4f78-8638-ded6c430db66.description: The ability to understand bias and manage inclusion is a competitive advantage in today's talent marketplace. Employees need the ability to interact, engage, and develop within a diverse workplace of intersecting group identities including race, gender, age, culture, class, ability, sexual orientation, and world view. This program develops these new 21st century leadership skills for all levels of employees. This four-workshop program includes pre-, inter-, and post-workshop asynchronous work.
02254293-ca34-4f78-8638-ded6c430db66.name: Inclusive Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Workshop 1 - Unconscious Bias, The Reframe: a deep dive into the behavioral psychology of unconscious bias, defining the many different types of biases and how they result in poor decision-making. We teach leaders how to slow down their socialized thinking and reframe the narrative.

Workshop 2 - Inclusive Teams: enables team members to manage the inevitable conflict that research suggests more diversity initially creates. We train learners to create a safe environment, manage optimal levels of conflict and resolve it before it becomes personal.

Workshop 3 - Developing Synergy: focuses on the magic that inclusion creates – developing skills in facilitation and inclusive decision making that brings together the various experiences and perspectives to create something larger than the component parts.

Workshop 4 - How to be an Ally: empowers learners to understand the responsibilities and opportunities inherent in these roles and how they can leverage their full self to show what is possible to others. And how to do it in a way that builds inclusiveness.

Learners practice applying their inclusive leadership skills after each workshop session, and meet with their accountability partner for peer learning and to share their experiences applying their new skills.

9b125438-81ca-4556-a12f-2b4e95b8b08d.description: As a foundational DEI concept, unconscious bias awareness is the primary skill in the inclusive skillset taxonomy as Orange Grove defines it. This workshop approaches unconscious bias from a research perspective, providing background on why human brains take shortcuts and how our person narratives shape the way we see the world.
9b125438-81ca-4556-a12f-2b4e95b8b08d.name: Unconscious Bias: The Reframe

badge_template_activities.title: Workshop - A deep dive into the behavioral psychology of decision making, detailing how the brain makes assumptions and how that can result in poor decision-making. We teach learners how to slow down their thinking and reframe the narrative to ensure decisions are strategic & based on rational analysis.

4d0a0324-8b37-4a11-8223-5f5a01b63cd6.description: Reading about diversifying talent is not the same as actively assessing and reworking a candidate pipeline. Our approach is hands-on, asking learners to dive into their data, identify the unspoken and unconscious filters defining “fit”, and examine the barriers for diverse candidates. From there, learners strategically edit a new process and pilot it to refine and adjust.
4d0a0324-8b37-4a11-8223-5f5a01b63cd6.name: Diverse Hiring

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete a self-paced asynchronous course with over 15 units to assess their talent pipeline, list potential adjustments, plan a pilot to test the changes, and then run a pilot. Through the course they learn about bias in their talent pipeline, how to adjust job descriptions and interview processes as well as how to run a hiring adjustment pilot and assess the results.
